title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: marina erte death : jury consider verdict .
lincoln a & e appeals for staff help from hospitals outside county .
golden wonder jobs boost at scunthorpe crisp factory .
woman , 61 , dies after a15 crash near sleaford last month .
boston residents call for end to streetlight switch-off .
bengal tigers unveiled at lincolnshire wildlife park .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me this week , we 'll be back with more live updates from 08:00 on monday .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good weekend .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's @ twitterid with the latest headlines from look north .
more on bbc one @ 18:30 .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weekend weather
text: it 's going to be a lovely weekend - but just how nice ?
here 's my full forecast :
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic and travel : lane blocked on the a46
text: a broken down camper van has blocked the a46 southbound in burton between the a57 saxilby road and the b1378 lincoln road .
expect delays if you 're heading that way especially because of the rush hour traffic .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: boston trial to continue into next week
text: after almost four hours of deliberating their verdict the jury in the trial of a boston man accused of murdering his estranged wife have been sent home for the weekend .
gytis griskevicius , 32 , of st ann 's lane , boston is alleged to have killed his wife marina erte , 33 , after becoming jealous at the new relationship she had begun with another man .
he denies the charges .

documents.title: plans submitted for new lincolnshire glamping park
text: plans have been submitted to create a new glamping park on a site currently classed as paddock land in brant broughton .
author: Lincolnshire Business

documents.title: spruce up the station
text: a lincoln charity 's taking on the challenge of improving the city 's railway station .
the rotary club 's planning to clean platforms and put flower tubs around the station .
it also wants to gather old photos of it for displays .
the charity says a similar project in market rasen station has been a success .

documents.title: lincoln a & e appeals for staff help from hospitals outside county
text: medical staff from outside lincolnshire are being sought to help out the current staffing crisis at lincoln county hospital a & e .
united lincolnshire hospital trust has confirmed it 's asking hospitals from elsewhere in the country to help staff the emergency department .
the trust said yesterday it was `` struggling to fill rotas '' over the next few weeks .
it comes as the trust appeals to people to .
only come to lincoln 's a & e unit in genuine emergencies .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: sixty new jobs at scunthorpe crisp factory
text: scunthorpe 's golden wonder factory has today revealed another 60 jobs have been created at the plant .
the news emerged as the town 's mp , nic dakin , visited the factory on colin road .
recent investment in the factory has seen an improvement in its production capabilities , the firm says .
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: woman dies after sleaford crash
text: a 61-year-old lincolnshire woman who was involved in a serious road collision near sleaford last month has died .
the woman , from the bourne area , was seriously hurt when her car collided with another vehicle which was towing a caravan on the a15 on 23 march .
police are re-appealing for anyone who witnessed the incident to get in touch .

documents.title: lincolnshire 's weather this afternoon
text: remaining grey for the rest of the day , with sunny spells only occasionally breaking through .
staying fairly warm but a bit chillier on the coast .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : lincoln parade celebrates raf 's freedom of the city
text: you 've seen the flyover , now watch the freedom of the city parade itself .
personnel from raf scampton and raf waddington have marched down lincoln high street as part of their celebrations :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today include :
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: marina erte death : jury consider verdict
text: jurors in the trial of a man accused of killing his estranged wife have retired to consider their verdict .
gytis griskevicius , 32 , of st ann 's lane , boston , denies killing marina erte , 33 , at her flat in boston on 20 may 2016 .
he is alleged to have beaten her before drowning her with a shower attachment and then setting fire to the flat .
lincoln crown court was told the attack was motivated by jealousy at a new relationship ms erte had begun .

documents.title: traffic and travel : accident on a46
text: drivers are being warned there 's been a crash on the a46 in faldingworth .
the road is currently partially blocked in both directions near buslingthorpe road .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lincolnshire wildlife park 's tigers take on 'ambassador ' role
text: i mentioned earlier that 11 of the world 's most dangerous kitties are now on show at the lincolnshire wildlife park .
it 's the country 's largest collection of bengal tigers , one of the most endangered animals in the world .
steve nichols , the park 's ceo , says he hopes the rescued tigers will inspire people to do their bit to protect the animals from extinction :
we want to use them almost as ambassadors for tigers to show people their plight in the wild .
if we can help one wild tiger then it 's worth these 11 living a life of luxury here . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: flyover for freedom of the city parade
text: it would n't be a parade in bomber county without a flyover .
watch this raf sentinel zoom over lincoln .
the video was taken from the roof of bbc radio lincolnshire towers :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: st george 's day celebrations coming to lincoln castle
text: lincoln castle has announced a range of events for st george 's day weekend .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: on yer bike ! final countdown for lincolnshire 's tour of the wolds
text: last minute preparations are under way for this weekend 's massive cycling event , lincolnshire 's tour of the wolds .
the first race starts on saturday at 08:00 from the london road pavillion in louth .
on sunday , the professionals take over with some of cycling 's biggest names taking to the county 's roads
this map shows just the first of three sections of the route :
the women 's route is 62 miles and the men 's route is 102 miles .
race director dan elmore says it 'll certainly be a spectacle :
we 've got all sorts of police escorts , motorbikes and safety marshals .
there are 150 bike riders followed by about 20 cars with all the spare bikes on .
it 'll be quite the sight ! ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: grimsby leisure complex plans go on display
text: plans for a proposed new £ 20m leisure complex in grimsby go on display today .
a new nine-screen cinema and restaurant complex is planned as an extension to freshney place near the riverhead .
the development is expected to generate at least 100 construction jobs at any one time , as well as up to 250 long-term jobs .
the consultation will be held today and tomorrow between 10:30 and 16:00 in the unit at the corner of baxtergate and clayton walk malls .

documents.title: boston residents call for end to streetlight switch-off
text: a heated debate about streetlights being turned off overnight took place in boston last night .
campaigners and local residents put their views to the town 's mp , matt warman , with some blaming government cutbacks for the controversial measure being introduced .
the county council has previously said funding cuts from central government meant the authority had to find new ways of saving money , including the streetlights switch-off .
lincolnshire police has said there 's no evidence of an increase in crime because of the switch-off .
lorraine o'connor , who organised the meeting , says she 's confident the lights will go back on :
it went very well .
we concluded at the end that we were united , we all want them back on and we 've all submitted our cases as to why they should be turned back on . ''
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: bbc weather watchers : glimpse through the cloud in south witham
text: in case you 've not looked out of the window recently , it 's still a bit grey across lincolnshire at the moment .
thanks to bbc weather watcher southwithamerbaz for sending this in which pretty much sums it up : it 's like being under the sea !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: lincoln plays host to raf freedom of the city parade
text: personnel from two lincolnshire raf stations are due to take part in a joint freedom of the city parade today .
airmen and women from raf scampton and raf waddington will march together through lincoln .
the parade will start at 10:45 from st martin 's square and is expected to finish just before midday at city square .
this is what it 's looked like in previous years :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: watch : fantastic felines unveiled at friskney
text: the largest collection of bengal tigers in the country goes on show to the public right here in lincolnshire later today .
the lincolnshire wildlife park in friskney has 11 of the big cats - one of the most endangered animals in the world - who have all come from private owners .
here they are , shortly before they were let into the outside part of their new enclosure which has been purpose-built for these fantastic felines :

documents.title: 'stay away from lincoln a & e unless it 's genuine emergency '
text: people are being urged not to go to a & e at lincoln county hospital unless it 's a genuine emergency .
it comes as the department struggles to fill its rotas because of a chronic shortage of doctors .
united lincolnshire hospitals nhs trust said it was `` working hard to maintain a safe service '' and urged people to visit a & e for only `` serious or life-threatening '' conditions .
doctor richard andrews , from the trust , says he wants people to consider whether other options for treatment would be more suitable :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lincolnshire 's morning weather forecast
text: starting chilly with mist in some areas of the county .
it 'll stay dry though with spells of sunshine developing in places .
feeling warm by the afternoon in most areas , but cooler near coasts where any sea breezes develop .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: your lincolnshire headlines this morning
text: here are some of the top stories from across the county so far this morning :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays on a159
text: traffic is currently queuing on the a159 ashby road in scunthorpe northbound from burringham road traffic lights to the a18 .
if you 're heading that way , be prepared to add an extra 10 minutes or so onto your commute .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln .
alex here , ready to bring you the latest from across the county .
we 'll bring you up-to-date news , travel , sport and weather updates as they happen .
is there something you think we should know about ?
you can get in touch through email , facebook .
and twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: playgroup cash funded disney spree
text: playgroup cash funded disney spree

documents.title: cocaine smugglers jailed over £ 80m haul
text: cocaine smugglers jailed over £ 80m haul

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today but news , sport , weather and travel updates will continue overnight .
i 'll be back with more live updates from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .

BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's @ twitterid with the latest headlines from look north .
more on bbc one @ 18:30 .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: minister defends benefits cap
text: the work and pensions minister is defending the benefits cap after being told that more than 100 lincolnshire families have only 50p a week left to pay their rent .
damian green is visiting businesses in lincolnshire today .
last night 's panarama programme reported how thousands of families across the country are being hit by the changes .
but mr green says the system is fair :
most people will regard it as unfair that you can receive more on benefits that the average family can earn by going out to work .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather
text: it 'll be a dry evening and night with variable cloud cover and clear spells .
here 's my full forecast looking forward to the weekend :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingskipper of £ 80m cocaine boat jailed for 16 years
text: the skipper of a drug-filled fishing boat has been jailed for 16 years for attempting to smuggle almost a tonne of cocaine into britain .
michael mcdermott , 68 , from waterford , ireland , was found guilty three weeks ago of his role in the plan to get the drugs into port at falmouth , cornwall .
two other men , david pleasants , 57 , from grimsby , and gerald van de kooij , 27 , from amersfoort , netherlands , have been jailed for 14 and 12 years respectively at bristol crown court .

documents.title: heckington says goodbye to village 's only bank
text: businesses in a large village near sleaford say the loss of its only bank is a blow - but not a surprise .
lloyds has announced its branch in heckington will shut this summer - one of 200 to close across the country .
andrew frank , who runs the windmill shop in the village , says residents knew it was coming :
it was always in the back of your mind .
when you 're in there you 're always taking note of many people there , if it 's busy .
because you think if it 's busy they wo n't close it . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: early start to the season for outdoor pool
text: an outdoor swimming pool in woodhall spa will be open for an extra six weeks this year , it 's been announced .
you 'll be able to visit the facility at jubilee park from good friday right through until october .
it costs £ 1,000 a day for the pool to be kept running so general manager joe stanhope says this year 's earlier start is a risk , but one he hopes will pay off :
it 's not a lot of money to come for a swim so it 's hard to cover those costs .
so we have to do an awful lot to build that up .
it 's about getting classes , lessons we can generate revenue from that type of thing a bit better . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: listen : 999 service 'not for cats ' ( should you need reminding )
text: when you 're a 999 operator then you must get more than your fair share of weird phone calls - but this one takes some beating .
east midlands ambulance service says inappropriate calls like this one stop them from helping people who actually need help - take a listen :
here are some of the other bizarre reasons they 've been called over the past month alone :
some people , eh ?
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: samantha baldwin arrested on sus of abduction
text: a woman who went missing with two boys for more than a week and was thought to have lincolnshire connections has been arrested on sus of abduction .
samantha baldwin , 40 , and her two sons , were found in a holiday home in nottinghamshire , police have said .
their disappearance on 27 march sparked a europe-wide police hunt involving more than 100 officers .
they were found in `` secluded accommodation '' just outside ollerton .
police had earlier said they believed they could have been in lincolnshire .

documents.title: decision time for major coastal development
text: a decision 's due to be made later on major plans to build a £ 9.5m luxury holiday village on the lincolnshire coast .
owners of hardy 's animal farm in ingoldmells have submitted at application for a site the size of about 100 football pitches .
the proposals include a holiday centre , hotel and petrol station based between caravan sites in ingoldmells and chapel st leonards .
east lindsey district councillors are expected to consider the application later today .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby mayor serves up school dinners
text: remember your school dinners ?
pink custard and hard cake ?
the mayor of grimsby is going to be remembering it all today as she serves the much-improved meals to pupils at healing primary .
councillor christina mcgilligan-fell is doing it to raise money as part of her charity challenge .

documents.title: watch : hospital trust in special measures again
text: we 've been bringing you news today that northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust , the trust which runs grimsby , scunthorpe and goole hospitals , .
has been put into special measures again .
it follows an inspection by the health watchdog the care quality commission ( cqc ) which has raised concerns over emergency , outpatient and maternity services .
take a look here to catch up on what we know now :
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : lifesaving flash mob descends on lincoln high street
text: earlier we told you about the launch of bbc radio lincolnshire 's campaign to get 10,000 people in the county to learn lifesaving cpr .
we thought we 'd kick things off with a bang in the middle of lincoln high street this lunchtime with the help of st john ambulance and lives .
take a look at what 's been going on :
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: in traffic delays as fire crews tackle a46 blaze
text: as we told you a short time ago , the a46 is closed southbound between the riseholme and carholme roundabouts because of a vehicle fire .
we 've been sent this photo by alan clifford who says traffic is currently stationary on both carriageways while the fire service deal with the blaze :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lincolnshire 's afternoon weather forecast
text: it 'll continue dry and mild this afternoon with variable cloud and sunny spells .
winds will be mainly light , and it 'll feel warm during any brighter periods in eastern areas .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: some of the top stories from across the county today :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: traffic and travel : a16 cleared
text: traffic is back to normal on the a16 in spalding near holbeach road .
there was a crash there earlier partially blocking the road , but it has now been cleared .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: weather watchers : blue skies at the foot of steep hill
text: it 's clouded over a bit now but it was a lovely start to the day in lincoln this morning .
thanks to bbc weather watcher isle explorer for sending this in .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: listen : hospital in special measures 'not good enough ' - mp
text: the mp for cleethorpes says it 's `` extremely disappointing '' that northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust has been returned to special measures .

an inspection by the care quality commission - the health watchdog - has highlighted significant concerns over urgent and emergency care , outpatients and maternity services at grimsby and scunthorpe hospitals .
martin vickers mp says it 's unacceptable :

documents.title: traffic and travel : crash on a16
text: the a16 in spalding is currently partially blocked , with queuing traffic around the a151 holbeach road .
there 's been a car accident there and drivers are being warned to avoid the area if possible .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : panoramic view of lincoln from city centre 's newest building
text: you may have noticed that the steelwork for the multi-storey car park at lincoln 's transport hub is up .
it 'll still be a while before it 's finished , though , so in the meantime take a look at the city from the very top :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln a & e 'struggling to provide full service '
text: lincoln county hospital declared an `` internal critical incident '' yesterday because of a severe shortage of a & e doctors , it 's been revealed .
the hospital says it 's struggling to fill rotas over the next few days and weeks and clinicians from other specialties have been drafted in to take up the slack .
the availability of agency staff - on which the hospital is `` overly reliant '' - has dropped `` drastically '' , according to united lincolnshire hospital trust , responsible for the hospital .
boston a & e is affected as well but to a lesser extent , the trust adds .
we are putting in steps to change our medical model .
this means doctors from other specialities will be asked to support a & e senior decision makers to diagnose and treat medical and surgical patients who come through the doors .
we need help from the public too and stay away unless they need emergency health treatment . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: watch : save a life campaign launched in lincolnshire
text: did you know that only one in 10 people survive a cardiac arrest outside of hospital ?
charlotte wright , who 's a newsreader at bbc radio lincolnshire , was one of them .
she collapsed while running , but defied the odds and survived when people stopped to give her cardiopulmonary resuscitation , or cpr .
that inspired bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign which is launched today and which is looking for 10,000 people in the county to learn cpr .
doctor simon topham , from lincolnshire lifesaving charity lives , explains how to do it :
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: let there be light : campaigners want streetlights back on
text: campaigners are due to meet in boston later to discuss their fears over streetlights being switched off in the town overnight .
the scheme has seen lights in some areas turned off at night to help save money .
some local residents claim the crime rate is going up in those places , though lincolnshire police say there 's no evidence to support this .
clare waterman , one of those leading the campaign , says the decision to turn off the streetlights must be reversed :
we need to be consulted and it needs to go back to the council and be re-voted on to get them switched back on , but without the support of the boston people it is n't going to happen . ''
lincolnshire county council says it 'll monitor any effects the changes to street lighting have , but it wo n't alter its policy at this time .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: bbc weather watchers : blue skies over boston caught on camera
text: our bbc weather watchers have once again been in action , capturing another day in lincolnshire on camera .
this is a lovely blue-sky shot from fiona in boston - though that windmill probably is n't moving much today !
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hospital trust special measures : 'little improvement , in some cases deterioration '
text: more now on the decision to put the trust responsible for hospitals in scunthorpe and grimsby back into special measures .
the health watchdog the care quality commission ( cqc ) has raised concerns over emergency , outpatient and maternity services .
an inspection , held between october and december last year , included scunthorpe general hospital and diana princess of wales hospital in grimsby .
amanda stanford , from the cqc , says the hospitals were n't up-to-scratch in some areas :
the real concerns were around urgent and emergency care where we had seen very little improvement , and in some cases deterioration , in the quality of that care .
in maternity services , which in 2015 we rated as good , we raised concerns this time . ''

documents.title: the headlines this morning
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today include :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: lincolnshire 's weather this morning
text: today will be dry with variable cloud and some bright or sunny spells .
cloud may be more persistent over some of the higher areas of the county .
winds will be mainly light , and it will feel warm during any brighter periods in the east .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingmissing mum and sons found
text: missing mum .
samantha baldwin and her two sons have been found , police have confirmed .
ms baldwin went missing with her sons on 27 march and was believed to have connections with lincolnshire .
a force statement said they were now with officers and safe .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: return to special measures for hospital trust
text: the trust which runs hospitals in grimsby and scunthorpe has been put back into special measures .
following a recommendation by the health watchdog the care quality commission ( cqc ) .
the cqc highlighted significant concerns over urgent and emergency care , outpatients and maternity services saying there had been an overall deterioration in quality and patient safety .
the northern lincolnshire and goole hospitals trust was previously placed in special measures in 2013 because of high mortality rates .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln .
alex here , ready to bring you all the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather as it happens , throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch , you can reach me through email , facebook .
and twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today , we 'll be back with more live coverage from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: peter levy has your headlines :
paying more to take away our garden waste bins + the yorkshire whisky company taking on its scottish rivals with @ twitterid on bbc one 1830
is peter their secret weapon ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: inquest opens into death of man killed in six-vehicle crash on a1
text: an inquest has opened into the death of a man killed in a six-vehicle crash on the a1 last month .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: we 're in for a dry but cloudy one overnight with clear skies breaking through only occasionally .
it 'll be fairly chilly but the winds will stay light .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: drivers stop your engines
text: drivers stuck in traffic in the centre of grantham are being urged to turn off their engines in a bid to cut air pollution .
leaflets are being handed out by south kesteven district council to raise awareness of the issue .
it affects the brook street and wharf road areas .
we really want to educate people and get the message out there about what individuals can do to improve the air quality , not just in the management area but across the district . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: mourners sought for lincolnshire veteran 's funeral
text: an appeal 's being made for people to attend a lincolnshire war veteran 's funeral .
robert neale , from belchford , died at the age of 88 in boston pilgrim hospital at the end of last month .
he was a widower with no children and so has no family to attend his funeral at alford crematorium at 10:00 on 20 april .
now his neighbour samantha curtis and the chairman of horncastle and district royal british legion , julian millington , are asking members of the public to come and pay their respects :
robert proudly served his country as a member of the british army .
i know he was injured in tripoli and that he carried the scars of those injuries for the rest of his life .
had it been necessary he would have given his life for his country .
in my mind , that makes him a hero and someone who should be rewarded with a memorable funeral . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: polish ambassador : 'uncertainty is the biggest problem '
text: poland 's ambassador to the uk says he hopes the future of eu migrants in boston is settled within months not years .
arkady rzegocki is visiting boston today which has a large eu migrant community .
he says the status of eu migrants should be a priority in the brexit negotiations .
uncertainty is the biggest problem for individuals , for families and and also businesses .
we 're trying to highlight that this is one of the most important issues during the negotiation
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: libraries hire security after disruption
text: libraries hire security after disruption

documents.title: watch : volkswagen beetle funeral cortege for lincoln teenager
text: you may have spotted a convoy of beetles , and other modified vws , making their way through lincoln city centre earlier this afternoon .
it was in memory of 16-year-old rhys durham-flynn who died a few weeks ago after being diagnosed with a brain tumour .
rhys was a car fanatic and had restored his own beetle .
an appeal went out through a facebook page called one last meet with rhys - where it says : `` let 's show how the vw community can come together ! ''
this is what happened :
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: missing man harold bailey found
text: an update on the story we ran a little earlier about a man who 'd gone missing from holbeach .
harold bailey , 79 , has now been found `` safe and well '' in north yorkshire , according to lincolnshire police .
the force says it wants to thank everyone who helped with their appeal .

documents.title: farmers left to up bill after tarmac scam
text: two farmers in lincolnshire have been left with hefty bills following a scam involving the dumping of rubbish .

the victims were asked if they wanted to buy tarmac road planings to make repairs on their land , but when it was delivered the bales were found to contain landfill waste , according to the environment agency .
in one case , 2,500 bales were delivered , which could cost £ 300,000 to dispose of .
the other farmer has 25 bales to get rid of , which could cost £ 3,000 .
the environment agency is investigating and is warning other landowners to be vigilant and not get caught by persuasive and convincing criminals .

documents.title: police appeal over missing 79-year-old man
text: police are appealing for help in finding a 79-year-old man who 's been missing from holbeach since tuesday afternoon .
harold bailey was last seen in the hollies at about 15:30 yesterday and is believed to have left in a blue nissan note .
he 's described as 5ft 10ins tall , of heavy build , with white hair .
he wears glasses and is clean shaven .
he was wearing black trainers , navy trousers , a blue shirt , a blue jacket and he walks with sticks or a walker .

documents.title: watch : a room with a view - the lincolnshire holiday cottage with a difference
text: forget french gites and spanish villas
there are n't many places which measure up to this holiday cottage at the old raf wainfleet station .
it used to be an air traffic control tower for the base , but now it 's been transformed into something very different .
take a quick tour here :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: man arrested after lincoln river rescue
text: a man in his 20s has been arrested after being rescued from the river witham in lincoln city centre .
it happened yesterday at about 18:30 behind the city centre primark store .
three fire crews attended the incident and sealed the area off while the man was rescued from the water .
he was then arrested for breaching bail conditions .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: boston borough council leader to step down
text: peter bedford has announced he 's stepping down as leader of boston borough council .
he 's been in the post for six years but will remain as a borough councillor for the coastal ward .
a new leader will be chosen at a full council meeting .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your lincolnshire headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today include :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: a17 disruption : five cows in vehicle
text: more now on the overturned vehicle that 's closed the a17 in fosdyke .
the vehicle was a blue isuzu trooper towing a livestock trailer with five cows in it , however the police say the animals seem to be unhurt .
no drivers or passengers have been injured either .
it 's hoped the road will reopen in the next half hour .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: polish ambassador arrives in boston
text: arkady rzegocki is visiting boston today - he 's been invited by the town 's mp matt warman .
an estimated 15,000 eu migrants live there , many from poland .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: barrowby a1 crash : charge over teenager 's scooter death
text: a man has been charged with causing the death of a 17-year-old scooter rider in a hit-and-run crash in lincolnshire .
callum warrilow , from leicestershire , was travelling north at barrowby on the a1 near grantham when he was struck by a car on 13 september .
kenneth wallace , 53 , of church lane , stibbington , cambridgeshire , is charged with three offences including causing death by dangerous driving .
he is due to appear at lincoln district magistrates ' court on thursday .

documents.title: it 's nearly easter so it 's time for boston to start planning for christmas
text: easter may be just around the corner , but money 's already being collected for boston 's christmas lights .
a new committee of volunteers has been set up with the aim of raising £ 10,000 following criticism over a. lack of festive lights last year .
the town 's 2016 christmas lights , criticised on social media as `` dismal '' , prompted disgruntled residents to brand the local council scrooges .
dylan taylor , chairman of the christmas in boston group , says cash is already coming in to try and help make 2017 's display one to remember :
some business have already been quite generous and donated some money towards the cause the main thing is that boston has christmas lights to be proud of .
we need to approach everyone in town , and boston has to get behind this or it wo n't happen . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wheelchair user injured in grimsby taxi collision
text: a 53-year-old man in an electric wheelchair has suffered a fractured shin after being involved in a collision with a taxi in grimsby .
it happened on station approach between 11:00 and 12:00 on friday 24 march .
the man was crossing the road close to the bank pub when the collision happened .
the driver , believed to be a woman , stopped briefly but left the area without exchanging details .
anyone who saw the incident is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: north hykeham dementia unit up for national award
text: a north hykeham dementia assessment unit has been shortlisted for a national award after the introduction of their personalised sensory toolkits .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays in lincoln and grantham
text: lincolnshire 's roads seem to be behaving themselves for the time being , with just a couple of areas with slow traffic to let you know about .
traffic 's currently running slow on the a46 northbound at the carholme roundabout , and also on the b1174 north parade in grantham where it meets broad street .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: bin charge rise earns hundreds of thousands of pounds for council
text: higher green bin charges have netted east lindsey district council an extra £ 300,000 despite a fall in the number of people using the garden waste disposal service , it 's been revealed .
charges for the bins have risen to £ 40 a year from this week , and the number of subscribers to the scheme has dropped by 2,000 in comparison with last year .
the authority says it can no longer afford to subsidise the service by £ 450,000 each year .
james gilbert , from the council , blames government funding cuts :
for years the council has faced significant financial pressure we published a programme of activity that aims to address a £ 6m funding shortfall .
making this service cost-neutral was one of the changes and it was supported by the community and public consultation . ''

documents.title: weather watchers : daybreak in sutton st. james
text: here 's a lovely shot from the south of the county .
thanks to bbc weather watcher matt smartie who 's captured this bright start to the day in sutton st james :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: the eyes have it ? : research into parkinson 's under way at lincoln uni
text: it 's hoped that research being pioneered at the university of lincoln could improve our understanding of parkinson 's disease .
parkinson 's affects the brain , which gets progressively damaged over time , and there 's currently no cure .
but professor tim hodgson , who 's been studying eye movement in people with the condition , believes the research can help those suffering with the disease and in its early diagnosis .
professor hodgson says there 's a noticeable difference between the eye movements of those with and without the condition :
there are differences between the eye movements of people with parkinson 's and healthy people .
particularly there 's a jerkiness that you can see when you zoom in on the precise characteristics of eye movements in parkinson 's . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lincolnshire 's wednesday weather forecast
text: most places will be dry with cloudier skies extending south through the day , although perhaps bringing some very isolated spots of drizzle across higher areas .
despite thickening cloud , some sunny intervals remain possible , especially in the south and east .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: the headlines this morning
text: the latest stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far this morning include :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here and ready to bring you all the latest from across the county .
we 'll have up-to-date news , travel , sport and weather from lincolnshire as it happens throughout the day .
is there something happening where you are that you think we should know about ?
get in touch with us through email , facebook .
or twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me for tuesday .
we 'll be back with more updates from 08.00 tomorrow .
meanwhile , breaking news , sport and travel will continue here throughout the night .
just before i go , let 's look back at five things we 've learned on our journey through the day :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: new lincolnshire tractor crime warning from police
text: we 're familiar with thieves taking tractors in lincolnshire .
but now it seems they 're leaving the vehicles behind and just taking the batteries :
to all farmers in the area - please be aware of a few current tractor battery thefts - please ensure they are kept safe and secure .
@ twitterid price of lead .
network rail has had battery 's nicked from gsmr masts in leeds area .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: row over lincoln leisure centre refurb
text: an extensive refurbishment programme has been revealed for a lincoln leisure centre , but some local residents are unhappy about the plans saying their own facilities will be lost .
the investment into the birchwood leisure centre would include a larger gym , exercise studios , a new cafe and children 's climbing and play areas .
city of lincoln council will be asked to approve the proposals next week .
but some birchwood users say social club facilities are used for fundraising events , social activities and presentation evenings .

documents.title: man charged over grantham a1 death crash
text: a man 's been charged with three offences in connection with a fatal collision on the a1 in lincolnshire .
the 53-year-old man has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving , failing to stop and failing to report an accident after the collision last september in grantham .
he 's due to appear before lincoln magistrates ' court on thursday .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby town defender collins unclear on future
text: grimsby defender danny collins says the club have yet to offer him a deal for next season .
the former wales international ( right ) was told in january that he was part of manager marcus bignot 's future plans but has not heard anything since .
`` when i extended , the gaffer said he wanted me here next season as well , '' collins , 36 , told bbc radio humberside .
`` but i 've not signed anything as such .
there 's one or two others in the same boat . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: british steel recruits new manufacturing trainees
text: british steel 's scunthorpe workforce has been bolstered by fresh talent after the company recruited 18 trainees in brand new roles .
it comes almost a year after uk-based investment firm greybull capital signed a deal .
safeguarding more than 4,000 jobs at the site .
the latest intake of recruits started this week as manufacturing trainees which are first-of-their-kind positions designed to develop the next generation of steelworkers .

this is the first time we 've recruited for manufacturing trainees in about 15 years , and we 've done so because we felt this was the perfect time to strengthen our manufacturing workforce as we look towards the future . ''
author: Hayley Ritchie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council chief announces departure
text: the chief executive of grantham-based south kesteven district council , beverly agass , is leaving to take up a new role in cambridgeshire , it 's been announced .
mrs agass has been appointed chief executive of south cambridgeshire district council and is expected to move in the summer .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'lessons learned ' over poppy widdison death
text: lessons have been learned and social care is improving following the death of toddler poppy widdison , the leader of north east lincolnshire council says .
poppy , who was four years old , died in grimsby in june 2013 after months of abuse which saw her fed drugs by her mum and ex-partner .
they were jailed for 13 years earlier this year .
council leader ray oxby has today told bbc radio humberside that 70 % of the council 's budget is spent on social care for adults and children .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: transformed lincolnshire coast toilet on awards list
text: a former seaside public toilet block which has been transformed into an ultra-modern beach hut on the lincolnshire coast is up for a major architectural award .
called beach hut by its creator , lincolnshire-based architect .
jonathan hendry , it was finished last year and is shortlisted for the royal institute of british architects 2017 prize .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: hospital trusts merger 'to save £ 9m '
text: patients in southern lincolnshire will benefit from the merger of two hospital trusts , according to the managers behind the move .
the peterborough and stamford nhs trust is now part of the new north west anglia nhs trust - a move which nhs bosses say will save £ 9m .
steven graves , chief executive of the new trust , says 30 % of his patients come from lincolnshire .
he 's denied claims by campaigners against the move that services will be cut .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: appeal over scunthorpe 's 'most-wanted '
text: police have appealed for help to find a 19-year-old scunthorpe man described as the town 's `` most wanted '' .
local residents are being advised not to approach thomas edgar - and to call 999 if he 's spotted .
det ch insp nicki miller , from scunthorpe police , says : `` thomas edgar is currently scunthorpe 's most wanted person and we are determined to ensure he is arrested .
`` he is a violent offender linked with serious assaults , criminal damage and driving offences and there is no doubt he is causing harm to the community .
`` due to the serious nature of his offending we are continuing to search for him and will do so until he has been located and is in police custody , '' adds det ch insp miller .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: the 1970s : when 7p bought you a red arrow
text: and i 'm not talking about one of the famous jet planes , obviously , but a wall 's ice lolly named after the lincolnshire-based aerobatic heroes .
maybe the organisers of the new scampton airshow - which starts this year - should get wall 's to bring these back :
thanks to claire hartley for the tweet !
just found this advert in a 1976 waddington airshow programme !
i think @ twitterid should bring this back !
bargain at 7p ! !
@ twitterid
ooh my fave flavour ! ! !
slurp !
unwrap it and it 's immediately covered in gnats
bringing it back would be nice , butcould it be a comercial success ?
i 'm afraid no .
and no , price would not be 7 p : )
raspberry and vanilla i could do but not strawberry
maybe they cancelled them when the team switched over to hawks 'cos they could n't afford to redo the advertising
does n't seem a very aerodynamic design .
and with joke on lolly stick
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: heritage cuts 'could affect up to 100 staff ' in lincolnshire
text: staff working in lincolnshire 's museums and heritage sites are facing cuts in their salaries and working hours , a union has warned .

lincolnshire county council says it needs to save £ 1.8m in the service which runs sites including gainsborough old hall ( above ) , lincoln 's usher gallery and the battle of britain memorial flight at coningsby .
while the council says it expects `` very few '' job losses , the union unison says up to 100 staff could be affected .
the final plans are due to be be published later this month .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: investment plan to rejuvenate seaside resorts
text: some of yorkshire and lincolnshire 's seaside resorts could be transformed with millions of pounds of government money .
cleethorpes , hornsea and the north york moors coast are getting money to help revive local economies .
one idea is to create a new tourism area in hornsea .
it is hoped the investment will create jobs and help seaside towns become year-round .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: bouncers put on the books at libraries
text: libraries in grimsby and immingham have had to hire `` professional security staff '' after young people started meeting there .
in a report being discussed by the council next week , it says `` increased numbers are using libraries as a venue for causing nuisance and disturbance to regular users '' .
the security staff are in position as a temporary measure and the library service is `` closely monitoring the situation '' , the report adds .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: weather : a dull afternoon but sunshine later
text: here 's your afternoon outlook :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police in new searches for missing mum and sons
text: police have been searching properties around newark as the hunt for a mum with lincolnshire connections who 's suspected of abducting her two sons continues into a second week .
samantha baldwin was last seen just over a week ago and it 's thought she 's with nine-year-old louis and six-year-old dylan madge .
officers say the further searches have been carried out as they follow through every line of enquiry in efforts to find the family .
anyone with information about the whereabouts of ms baldwin or her two sons is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: business link-up sees four new firefighters ready for action
text: lincolnshire fire and rescue service has teamed-up with a local business in a bid to boost the number of retained firefighters .
in what 's being described as a `` county first '' , workers from bardney-based rase distribution have taken part in a bespoke training course alongside senior fire officers .
three employees from the firm signed up to the course and will now be able to join the crew at bardney fire station - along with a fourth recruit who 's a local taxi driver .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : blue in belton
text: we always love to feature the best you 've taken of lincolnshire and our bbc weather watchers never let us down .
look at the idyllic scene below caught on camera at the weekend by amy coutin in belton - it could be a postcard !
why not email or tweet your photographs to us ?
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: lack of paint halts 'just jane ' restoration
text: a shortage of paint is being blamed for a delay in the £ 250,000 renovation of a world war two lancaster aircraft in lincolnshire .
the avro lancaster nx611 , known as just jane , is being restored at the lincolnshire aviation heritage centre in east kirkby .
andrew panton , from the centre , says `` quite a lot more paint '' is still needed .
it will take at least three weeks to produce more specialist paint for the plane which was last painted 40 years ago .
eventually , it 's hoped the lancaster bomber will fly again but that is `` several years '' away , according to mr panton .
author: Trevor Gibbons
BBC News Online, Yorkshire

documents.title: head teacher defends 'duvet day ' for staff
text: a lincolnshire head teacher 's defended his decision to offer so-called `` duvet days '' as an incentive to recruit more staff .
long sutton primary has set aside more than £ 3,000 of the school 's annual budget to pay for the perk .
critics argue it sends out the wrong message about teaching , but head teacher bill lord says every year the school struggles with recruitment :
each year we get to july panicking about whether we are going to be able to provide the fantastic staff that our fantastic kids deserve .
we are in a time of austerity and wages do n't go up , and it leads to people looking at other alternatives . ''

documents.title: batemans brewery named one of the best in the uk
text: wainfleet-based batemans brewery has been named as one of the best breweries in the uk and ireland in a new report .
author: Lincolnshire Business

documents.title: out-of-town centre 'will still be restricted '
text: there 's a row between spalding 's town centre traders and the local council over out-of-town shopping .

chairman of the spalding town centre traders association darren sutton says south holland district council is not being fair by supporting the expansion of the out-of-town springfields centre ( below )
but the council says springfields plays a complimentary role - and attracts more than 2.5m visitors per year .
the authority also says it 'll continue to operate under the existing restrictions designed to avoid competition with the town centre .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: new effort to protect marine life from beach waste
text: environment campaigners in our region are calling for greater awareness of the harm plastic is doing to our seas .
it comes as scientists plan to harvest waste material from uk beaches to make bottles instead of using new plastic .
it 's part of an effort to reduce the impact plastics have on marine life .

documents.title: town centre traders ' anger over shopping village expansion
text: a row 's broken out in spalding over the planned expansion of the shopping outlet - springfields .
it 's set to grow by 20 % by 2021 - and by the same amount again in the following five years .
the town 's retailers association says the council 's ignoring a rule designed to protect traders in the town centre .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : a chance of showers early but drier later
text: here 's lisa gallagher with the forecast :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: immingham port in line for major investment
text: the operators of the port of immingham , associated british ports ( abp ) , have announced a £ 50m investment which it says will `` double capacity '' .
the money will also be spent in hull .
the firm says there has been a 41 % growth in use of the ports since 2013 , with the trend expected to continue .
it will put in new cranes and double the capacity of both container terminals .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : a46 blockage
text: one lane 's closed because of a broken down lorry on the a46 lincoln-bound carriageway near newark showground .
the police are on scene .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lincoln city 2-0 dagenham & redbridge
text: lincoln city 2-0 dagenham & redbridge

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln and welcome to our live pages where you 'll find all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send an .
email .
to us , or message us on .
facebook .
or .
twitter .
we 're really keen to see your or hear any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: victim and ex 'had sex ' before murder
text: victim and ex 'had sex ' before murder

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today .
our live coverage will continue with news , sport and travel updates through the evening and i 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: watch : vintage footage of grantham unearthed
text: take a look at this blast from grantham 's past .
south kesteven district council 's memories of wyndham park campaign has unearthed this footage from the 1960s .
it features a somewhat stroppy narrator explaining the importance of the borough surveyor :
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: it 's a bright end to the day today before it begins to cloud over a little later on .
some light rain arriving from the west - which will have spread across the county by midnight .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: police are looking for this man after major jewellery theft
text: police want to trace a man after an enormous stash of jewellery was stolen from a home in a lincolnshire village .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: leap in lincoln park-and-ride bus users
text: after a bit of a slow start , more than 500 people are now using linooln 's park-and-ride bus service every week , according to the city 's business improvement group .
the service runs between waitrose on nettleham road and the city centre and was launched on 20 february .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: the red arrows show 5 live some love
text: 5 live were broadcasting from the home of the red arrows , raf scampton , earlier and they world famous aerobatic team made them feel very welcome .
lots of us in lincolnshire are lucky enough to see the reds practicing fairly regularly but if you 're like me then you never get sick of seeing displays like this :
love is in the air @ twitterid @ twitterid
got a lot of love for those guys !
# redarrows
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: concern for missing man last seen in boston
text: police say they 're worried about the welfare of 51-year-old mark sweatman .
he was last seen at the salvation army kitchen in the high street , boston , around 18:30 on sunday 2 april .
he 's only recently begun living there and is originally from cambridgeshire .
police want you to get in touch if you 've seen him .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: more protection needed for ancient woodlands
text: the woodland trust says more protection is needed for some of the county 's oldest trees .
the charity , which has its hq in grantham , says there are five ancient woods under threat in lincolnshire .
it 's asking for support for a campaign to urge the government to restrict housing developments .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lincolnshire breaks for refugees
text: families in lincolnshire are providing asylum seekers and refugees with short stays in their homes .
it 's part of a scheme which offers respite for those who 've fled war-torn countries and are currently housed in hostels and apartments in bigger cities .
a couple of days each month , dianna broadmeadow and her husband play host to a woman from iran at their home in louth :
my husband and i are lucky enough to help because we have a house with spare bedroom .
we just thought we could accommodate someone for a few days at a time and there are at least 20 other people who are giving time and hospitality . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: in lincoln 10k 2017
text: more than 5,500 runners took to the streets of the city at the weekend for the annual run for all lincoln 10k , many raising money for a host of deserving charities .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: coastal cash injection a 'significant boost '
text: more now on the extra money being invested in our coastal towns , with the coastal communities fund giving cleethorpes almost £ 4m after a successful bid from north east lincolnshire council .
coastal communities minister , andrew percy , who 's also the mp for brigg and goole , says the money should be just a start :
there 's still a lot of work to be done to get our resorts and coastal communities where they 're in position where they 're attractive for people to visit .
so there 's more we can do , but this is a significant boost for those communities in our area . ''

documents.title: weather watchers : the bridge to nowhere ?
text: no , that headline 's not a stab at hull city of culture 2017 , i promise .
but the thick fog meant that you simply could n't see to the end of the humber bridge this morning .
thanks to bbc weather watcher beely from barton who 's sent us this excellent shot :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: search continues for missing mum and sons
text: we told you last week about a. mum with lincolnshire connections who 's gone missing with her two sons .
samantha baldwin , 42 , has not been seen since last monday and is believed to be with louis madge , nine , and dylan madge , six .
over the weekend police released new of the boys and their mother , which were cctv images taken days before they disappeared .
police say samantha baldwin has connections to our area , and anyone with information about her or her sons ' whereabouts is being asked to contact police urgently .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather forecast
text: a dry , pleasant afternoon with sunny spells before it begins to cloud over as we head into the evening .
there 'll be some drizzle in the early hours of tomorrow morning which will slowly clear .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today include :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: could it be you ? hunt is on for grimsby 's euromillions winner
text: check your lottery ticket if you live in grimsby - you could be a millionaire !
someone from the town won the euromillions on friday 17 march , but has so far failed to claim claimed their prize .
you 've got until 13 september to reveal yourself .
however , if you 've decided a life of luxury is n't for you then i 'll happily take the ticket off your hands
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: search continues for man wanted over spalding burglary
text: lincolnshire police are continuing to search for a 23-year-old man wanted in connection with an investigation into a burglary .
adam hughes is being sought in connection with the burglary at holbeach drove , near spalding , on 15 march .
anyone with information about his whereabouts is being asked to contact police .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: raf scampton plays host to bbc 5 live
text: the bbc 5 live team have got a nice day out today .
they 're here in lincolnshire broadcasting from raf scampton the home of the red arrows :
join @ twitterid on air when he brings @ twitterid to the red arrows @ twitterid scampton between 1pm-4pm today # red5live
good luck , nihal .
you 're in good hands and those hawks are very well made .
# modesty
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays on a16 expected to continue
text: more now on the crash northbound on the a16 in algarkirk we mentioned a little earlier .
it 's now expected that the stretch of road between the a17 junction and the b1397 station road junction will be closed until the afternoon peak .
the surrounding roads are getting busy as a result , so you might want to change your travel plans .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lincolnshire team sets sights on fa people 's cup glory
text: the fa cup fairy tale may have ended for lincoln city , but a lincolnshire five-a-side disability football team is through to the finals of the fa people 's cup .
both the a side and b side of gainsborough 's midtown united have made it to the end of the amateur competition in their respective divisions .
the finals are due to be held at the end of the month .
player-manager kieran robson says he believes they could both go all the way :
the ability is there for both teams .
a great group of lads and it 's an absolute pleasure to play with them .
i hope they turn up on the day , get the job done and get the rewards they deserve . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: have your say : bbc listening project wants to hear from you
text: do you fancy having a conversation between you and a friend or family member recorded for posterity ?
if so , the bbc 's listening project is for you - and its recording booth is .
travelling around east yorkshire and lincolnshire from today .

the listening project aims to collect a fascinating archive of insights into modern britain , with people of all ages sharing what they think about their lives and loves , enthusiasms and disappointments , successes and failures :
our # listeningproject tour kicks off @ twitterid take a look around the booth !
tour dates here :

documents.title: motorbiker dies after crash
text: a 56-year-old horncastle man has died after being involved in a crash with two cars .
it happened at about 17:15 on friday evening on an unclassified road between waddingworth and bardney .
the incident involved a silver honda motorbike , a silver ford ranger and a silver skoda .
anyone with any information is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: rise in reports of children meeting paedophiles in lincolnshire
text: there 've been over 50 reports of child abusers grooming then meeting children in lincolnshire in the past five years , according to children 's charity the nspcc .
today , long-awaited new powers to tackle paedophiles who target children through social media or mobile phones have taken effect .
this means police will be able to arrest anyone who sends a sexual message to a child , and they can intervene before physical abuse takes place .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : muggy start in spalding
text: it 's been a bit misty and damp for most of us in lincolnshire so far this morning .
thankfully it should burn off , but it makes for some good photos in the meantime .
weather watcher overthebridge took this shot in spalding :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cash boost for east yorkshire and lincolnshire coastal communities
text: hornsea , cleethorpes , hull and the area near spurn point are to get about £ 9m worth of investment to help boost the local economy .
the cash comes from the government 's coastal communities fund , with cleethorpes and hornsea getting the lion 's share to help bring more tourists into the resorts .
it is hoped the investment will create jobs and help our seaside towns become year-round destinations .

documents.title: thousands take part in lincoln 10k
text: it was a big weekend for the county 's runners , with the lincoln 10k returning for another year .
about 6,000 people took part in the road race in the city 's uphill area :
the fastest person , joe wilkinson from lincoln wellington athletic club , crossed the finish line in just 30 minutes and 23 seconds .
lots of people were running for charity as well , including a team from the rnli :
coming through hand in hand .
there 's teamwork .
# lincoln10k

documents.title: traffic and travel : spalding bridge roadworks
text: just a quick reminder that wisbech road bridge is shut from today until next friday while essential works are carried out .
traffic will be diverted via low road , queen 's road , holbeach road , the a151 and the a16 .
you might want to change your plans accordingly .

documents.title: the weather this morning
text: western parts are likely to start dry and bright , though low cloud , mist and fog may affect central and eastern areas at first .
this soon clearing , becoming dry and bright across the region by mid-morning , though becoming breezy later .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here and ready to bring you all the very latest from across the county .
we 'll have news , travel , sport and weather as it happens and more throughout the day .
is there something happening where you are ?
get in touch via email , facebook .
or twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live
